data.title: Mor Gabriel aus Beth Qusṭan: Leben und Legende eines syrischen Abtbischofs aus dem 7. Jahrhundert
data.abstractNote:
Abbot-Bishop Mor Gabriel, born in 593 in Beth Qustan, is the most famous son of the Tur Abdin, the “Mountain of the Servants (of God),” a region in south-eastern Anatolia. The most common form of name given to the monastery, built in 397 and one of the most respected and wealthiest foundations in the orient, refers to him. Mor Gabriel is famous for his miracles and, now as then, binds people together across confessional and religions boundaries.
This book offers the first annotated German translation of the Syrian Life of Mor Gabriel. The author, himself a native of Beth Qustan, has based his work on a thorough study of the sources. He takes into account oral as well as literary traditions and subjects contradictory reports to historical criticism. Many illustrations of the monastery and the original manuscripts complete the work
